action.content:
Clarify the meaning of sentences with ambiguous pronouns.

Q: In the following sentences, explain the antecedent of the pronoun (which thing the pronoun refers to), or state that it is ambiguous.
Sentence: The chief told the counselor that they took the day off.
Options:
(A) The chief took the day off
(B) The counselor took the day off
(C) Ambiguous
A: (A)

Q: In the following sentences, explain the antecedent of the pronoun (which thing the pronoun refers to), or state that it is ambiguous.
Sentence: The manager sent a message to the secretary, but he didn't reply yet.
Options:
(A) The secretary didn't reply yet
(B) The manager didn't reply yet
(C) Ambiguous
A: (A)

Q: In the following sentences, explain the antecedent of the pronoun (which thing the pronoun refers to), or state that it is ambiguous.
Sentence: Bailey will plan to meet the director at his office
Options:
(A) It will be Bailey's office
(B) It will be the director's office
(C) Ambiguous
A: (C)

Q: In the following sentences, explain the antecedent of the pronoun (which thing the pronoun refers to), or state that it is ambiguous.
Sentence: The writer tried to fool the salesperson and told them a fake story.
Options:
(A) Told the writer a fake story
(B) Told the salesperson a fake story
(C) Ambiguous
A:
action.label: context

action.content:
Q: In the following sentences, explain the antecedent of the pronoun (which thing the pronoun refers to), or state that it is ambiguous.
Sentence: The manager will plan to travel to the office and then will take the train to their hometown.
Options:
(A) The office
(B) The hometown
(C) The manager
(D) The train
E: (A) and (B) - The antecedent of "the office" is the office, and the antecedent of "the hometown" is the hometown.
Q: In the following sentences, explain the antecedent of the pronoun (which thing the pronoun refers to), or state that it is ambiguous.
Sentence: The team will plan to travel to the stadium and then will take the train to their hometown.
Options:
(A) The stadium
(B) The hometown
(C) The team
(D) The train
E: (A) and (B) - The antecedent of "the stadium" is the stadium, and the antecedent of "the hometown" is the hometown.
Q: In the following sentences, explain the antecedent of the pronoun (which thing the pronoun refers to), or state that it is ambiguous.
Sentence: The team will plan to travel to the stadium and then will take the train to their hometown.
Options:
(A) The stadium
(B) The hometown
(C) The team
(D) The train
E
action.label: response
